agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry within past 90 days

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry within past 30 days

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
service_description: Provides street maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign maintenance, trash and residential recycling pick-up, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
site_details: Call for information or to submit a request or make a report. -- To start trash pick up, call Connersville Utilities: (765)825-2158 -- Walk in for recycling bags.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Connersville in Fayette County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Connersville in Fayette County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Connersville in Fayette County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Connersville in Fayette County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-11:30am and 12:30pm-4pm -- Parks open Dawn till dusk unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services and collects trash fees for the city of Connersville in Fayette County.
site_details: Walk in to set up new service. -- Account information and bill payment are available at the website. -- A payment depository is located north of the drive-up window.
site_eligibility: Open, serves the city of Connersville in Fayette County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a community meal to those in need, and provides financial assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with rent, utility, prescription, and medical care expenses for people in need.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. Leave voicemail for a return call.
site_eligibility: Have not received financial assistance from this agency in the past year

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations within the city of Connersville in Fayette County. Non-emergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Serves the city of Connersville

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Fayette County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Fayette County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 2pm
Office: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 2pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving Fayette County.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Limit twice (2) visit per month

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Fayette County.
service_description: Maintains the Fayette County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: An urgent care clinic in Fayette County.
service_description: Offers a walk-in clinic for acute, minor injuries and illnesses, sexually transmitted diseases/infections and HIV testing, flu shots, and physicals for school, sports, or work. Full laboratory services and X-rays are available to clients. Referrals to other social and medical services are provided, when necessary. Clients with serious conditions are referred to a hospital or to the patient's regular doctor.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a thrift store.
service_description: Sells donated baby through adult-sized clothing, dishes, kitchenware, and bedding at discounted prices.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Fayette County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Fayette County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Fayette County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for information

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips, including public transportation.
service_description: Sells gently used clothing, small appliances, and household items at discounted prices.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SOLDIERS IN THE ARMY OF THE LORD OUTREACH
agency_desc: A faith-based organization providing charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry.
site_name: SOLDIERS IN THE ARMY OF THE LORD OUTREACH
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and gently used clothing, furniture, and household items to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SOLDIERS IN THE ARMY OF THE LORD OUTREACH
agency_desc: A faith-based organization providing charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides six-month transitional housing program for men. Program includes sober living, group meetings, mental health services, financial planning, and re-entry to employment assistance.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for an assessment. -- Participants must agree to obtain employment after two weeks.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
site_name: FIREFLY CHILDREN AND FAMILY ALLIANCE - CONNERSVILLE
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 12
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Fayette, Franklin, Henry, Rush, Union, and Wayne County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing recovery support services, education, and advocacy to those impacted by drug use and living with or at risk of infectious diseases.
service_description: Offers harm reduction services, including free naloxone access, syringe access and disposal, treatment referrals, and safe sex supplies.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_schedule: Mon 9am-1pm; Tues 5pm-6:30pm; Thurs 9am-4pm; Fri and Sat 4pm-10pm

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Fayette County -- Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) --Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI) -- other special   circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in the Fayette County School Corporation -- Ages 3-22 years -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, and hearing impairments

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Library: Mon-Thurs 10am-7pm; Fri 9am-5:30pm; Sat 9am-5pm -- Book Deliveries: Varies
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a resident library card: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a hygiene closet and addiction counseling.
service_description: Provides personal grooming supplies and cleaning products to those in need. Limited service area.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Fayette County -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers transitional housing and support services for women recently released from prison or dealing with substance abuse.
service_description: Provides faith-based transitional housing and supportive services for women dealing with substance abuse or those recently released from prison.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: Women, age 18 years or older -- Recently released from prison -OR- dealing with substance abuse or addiction

agency_desc: Provides animal control for the city of Connersville and an animal shelter for Fayette County.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Fayette County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, accepts surrendered animals from the public, and provides shelter and adoption services for homeless and unwanted dogs and cats. Due to space limitations, not all surrendered animals can be held for adoption and may be euthanized at any time.
site_details: Adopt or Claim: Call or walk in. -- Clients should be prepared to provide contact information for their landlord (if applicable) -- To Surrender: Call to schedule an appointment to surrender animal. For after-hour emergencies, call Fayette County Dispatch.
site_eligibility: To Report an Animal Concern: Open (serves the town of Connersville in Fayette County) -- To Adopt: Open (subject to review by staff to ensure safety of animal)To Surrender a Pet: Living in Fayette County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are insured, uninsured, or whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - FAYETTE COUNTY - CIRCUIT, SMALL CLAIMS, AND SUPERIOR COURTS
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Fayette County, the people are given a choice  of Superior or Circuit Court to handle small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in to the County Clerk's office.
site_schedule: Circuit Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Superior Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon
Circuit Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon -- Superior Court: Mon-Tues, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Fayette County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Fayette County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Fayette County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - FAYETTE COUNTY - PROBATION
service_description: Provides probation services for the county Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_schedule: Mon and Tues 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm; Wed 8:30am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Thurs 8:30am-noon; Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4pm
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Circuit and Superior Courts

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email to schedule an appointment or for more information.
site_eligibility: Veterans, surviving spouses, and children of veterans

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm; Thurs 8am-12:30pm

Clerk's Office: Mon, Tues, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm; Thurs 8am-12:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Fayette County

agency_desc: A state-funded program offering instruction and testing for the High School Equivalency diploma, as well as English as a second language (ESL) classes.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place on a monthly-basis and is available in computer format.
site_details: Call or text to cell phone to register for the test. Payment due at registration.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers family planning, pregnancy testing, and various parenting education programs.
service_description: Offers a variety of parent education and life skills classes. Topics include childbirth education, new born and infant care, childhood development, stress management, budgeting, resume building, job interview skills, and more.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon noon-3pm; Tues noon-4pm; Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 1pm-7pm -- Classes: Vary

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - FAYETTE COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Fayette County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). Persons already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Applications for the waiting list is closed. When they are open, you will be required to create a Waitlist Check account and have a valid email address.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Waiting List: CLOSED
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Fayette County government offices.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in the County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4pm; Wed 8:30am-5pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Fayette County

agency_desc: "OVGC is an investor-owned utility which provides natural gas distribution and transportation services to residential, commercial, industrial, and governmental customers in 16 Indiana counties and 1 county in Ohio."
site_name: OHIO VALLEY GAS CORPORATION - CONNERSVILLE DISTRICT
service_description: Provides natural gas utility services and handles billing and connections/disconnections for customers in select areas of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Ripley, and Union County. Special payment plans, including a budget payment plan to spread the cost of service out more equally throughout the year, may be available for customers.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Service area includes portions of Dearborn, Fayette, Franklin, Ripley, and Union County

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.

site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling; mental health evaluations; psychiatric disorder treatment; and substance abuse assessment and treatment for adults, adolescents, and children. Sliding-scale fees and other forms of financial assistance are available for income-eligible clients.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members
